*

Children's City

Dec 19, 2011

…shivering, so cold… …rising up, he could see–Trussaydn. And the smiling face of Destinee. Bed moderately warmer. Sank down below… …bed much warmer now. The children are helping, making cardboard houses, a city spread out across the bed, around the convalescent Montano. Sinking below again… …a neighborhood. Hmong, Spanish, and Somali. With each turn of the head, a new neighborhood. Bed is on fire. The victory of heat. Sinking… …what is this bed? How strange, how foreign. What are these strange lands? But at least I can speak Hmong. Black quilts of cloud. I am a stranger and this is not a bed.
